intro: Tithymalus rotundifolius, commonly known as the round-leaved tithymalus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its rounded, heart-shaped leaves and small, clustered white or yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shady environments, such as woodlands or stream banks. It is native to parts of Europe and Asia, where it thrives in temperate climates. Its botanical features make it a notable species for ecological and horticultural study.
